mainBoard.flavorText: Too often, some self-described genius comes up with a "labor-saving device" that ends up creating far more work.

mainBoard.name: Ensoul Artifact
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 5/5 in addition to its other types.

rulings.text: Effects that modify a creature's power and/or toughness, such as the ones created by Titanic Growth or a +1/+1 counter, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch power and toughness.

If the artifact was already a creature, its base power and toughness will each become 5. This overwrites any previous effects that set the creature's base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after Ensoul Artifact becomes attached to the artifact will overwrite this effect.

The artifact retains any types, subtypes, or supertypes it has. Notably, if an Equipment becomes an artifact creature, it usually can't be attached to another creature. If it was attached to a creature, it becomes unattached.

The resulting artifact creature will be able to attack on your turn if it's been under your control continuously since the turn began. That is, it doesn't matter how long it's been a creature, just how long it's been on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 5/5 in addition to its other types.

rulings.text: If Juggernaut can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under your control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, you're not forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

mainBoard.name: Shrapnel Blast
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the artifact you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.
You must sacrifice exactly one artifact to cast this spell; you can’t cast it without sacrificing an artifact, and you can’t sacrifice additional artifacts.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: Purphoros once loved Nylea, the god of the hunt. His passion inspired his most astounding works of art.
